net.zer0bandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse.content

Class SQLiteHouseKeeper<H extends SQLiteHouse>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      • net.zer0bandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse.content.SQLiteHouseKeeper<H>
  • Type Parameters:
    H - the SQLiteHouse implementation to which this provider is bound

    public class SQLiteHouseKeeper<H extends SQLiteHouse>
extends android.content.BroadcastReceiver
    A class which is bound to a SQLiteHouse implementation and receives intents that request queries from the underlying database. This class fills the role of a ContentProvider without implementing that class's API, since the prototypes of the ContentProvider's methods don't fit with the workflow of a SQLiteHouse.
    Since:
    zer0bandwidth-net/android 0.1.7 (#50)

      • register

        public SQLiteHouseKeeper<H> register()

        Returns:
        (fluid)
        See Also:
        SQLiteHouseKeeper.DefaultSignals, SQLiteHouseSignalAPI

        public SQLiteHouseKeeper<H> register(SQLiteHouseSignalAPI api)
        Registers the keeper instance as a BroadcastReceiver in its context.
        Parameters:
        api - the signal contract between the keeper and its relays; if null, then the keeper will be unregistered instead!
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • handleCustomAction

        protected void handleCustomAction(android.content.Context ctx,
                                  android.content.Intent sig,
                                  java.lang.String sToken)
        Override this method to handle custom actions not covered by the standard set defined in SQLiteHouseSignalAPI. The default implementation writes an information log stating that the action is unrecognized.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context from which the signal originated
        sig - the received signal
        sToken - the action token parsed from the signal
